data.description: A conceptual framework for network communication consisting of layered protocols, enabling standardized data exchange across diverse systems and network scales.<SEP>A four-layer networking model used in internet protocols with the application layer as its topmost tier.<SEP>A four-layer networking model used in internet protocols, with the application layer positioned as its topmost tier.<SEP>A networking framework designed for efficient, error-free data transmission using a four-layer architecture. It serves as the foundation of the internet and is widely adopted in practical network systems.<SEP>A networking framework developed without built-in security features, making networks susceptible to cyber attacks.<SEP>A practical bottom-up implementation model reflecting actual internet operations with fewer integrated layers, serving as the de facto standard for network construction.<SEP>A practical four-layer networking model with tightly integrated functionalities across all layers essential for internet-based data transmission.<SEP>Networking architecture framework enabling communication across diverse systems through layered protocols.<SEP>Practical 4-layer architecture powering the internet, integrates OSI layers, relies on TCP for reliability and UDP for connectionless transmission.<SEP>TCP/IP模型是实用型四层网络架构，广泛用于互联网，整合了OSI多层功能，主要依赖TCP协议保证可靠性传输，UDP则不保证可靠性。<SEP>The TCP/IP (Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol) model is a foundational network architecture model with four abstraction layers. It forms the basis for internet communication and prioritizes practical implementation over strict layering.<SEP>The TCP/IP model is a networking framework consisting of four hierarchical layers that define communication protocols for internet and network systems.<SEP>The TCP/IP model is a networking framework designed for efficient and error-free data transmission. It follows a four-layer architecture where each layer applies specific network protocols to optimize data structure. It serves as the foundation of the internet and is widely adopted in practical network systems.<SEP>The conceptual framework for internet communication protocols, designed with practical application focus but inherent security limitations.
